title: **Apple Macbook League Log-In is black; Cannot turn off computer; Cannot uninstall.**
body:
I attempted to open the Log-in Screen for League on an up-to-date MacBook Pro laptop by my usual method: clicking the League Icon in my dashboard. It did not pop up. I attempted to quit, and clicked the icon again. A black rectangle the size of the log-in screen popped up. I tried to quit again. I could not. I attempted to force quit. The option is not allowed. I attempted to shut off the computer. I was not allowed to by my own computer on the grounds that the League application was still running. A pop-up showed up asking if I want to retry to close the application. I tried three times, and none of the attempts worked. I tried uninstalling the application by dragging the app to the trash can. The app merely popped back into its original place. I tried again with the dashboard icon. It merely deleted the app from my dashboard.

Needless to say, I am not tech-savvy in the slightest, but what are my options?

Edit: I have not yet tried force shutting down the entire computer, but I would prefer to find out why I had the problem in the first place before I try that.

replies.body: It sounds like your OS is having a really hard time getting league to launch for some reason. Since it seems like the client is crashing, let's go over each step in our [Mac Crash Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes#section-mac) to see if we can narrow down what's really going on.

Thank you so much for responding, however I've forced the entire computer to shut down and the client seems to be running fine now (though I did have to reinstall the new client and it initially wouldn't allow me to play the first time I logged in). I don't want to waste your time, so if this issue no longer warrant your attention, I fully understand, but if possible, could you help me figure out what caused the issue?

I've looked through the steps, and I have the minimum system requirements, the operating system has fully updated, administrator privileges are all configured to the specified settings, and the in-game settings were all default save for all forms of audio, which was turned off. 

That leaves the possibility of needing to repair corrupted files, reset the SMC, or reset the NVRAM. Seeing as there were power outages recently in my area, I'm tempted to suspect the SMC is the issue, but as I said, I'm clueless when it comes to electronics. 

I don't know if this issue will come up again, but do you recommend reseting all three regardless, just to be safe?
Thanks, and sorry for taking so much of your time, again!
